div.div: διάκτορος : runner, guide; epith. of Hermes as messenger of the gods and conductor of men and of the shades of the dead, Il. 24.339, Od. 24.1. (Formerly connected with διάγω, now generally with διώκω. The traditional derivation is not less probable because more obvious.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
